coredata.dc:title: Real-time Large Scale Traffic Sign Detection
coredata.prism:publicationName: 2018 14th Symposium on Neural Networks and Applications, NEUREL 2018
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

abstract.ce:para: Automatic traffic sign detection and recognition has achieved good results using convolutional neural networks. Novel architectures are still being proposed in order to improve accuracy of detection and segmentation of traffic sings. In this paper, we are examining the possibility for traffic sign detection and recognition in real-time. For that purpose, we employed a novel YOLOv3 architecture, which has been proven to be fast and accurate method for object detection. It was shown that real-time detection can be achieved, even on HD images, with mAP above 88%.

abstract.ce:para: Automatic traffic sign detection and recognition has achieved good results using convolutional neural networks. Novel architectures are still being proposed in order to improve accuracy of detection and segmentation of traffic sings. In this paper, we are examining the possibility for traffic sign detection and recognition in real-time. For that purpose, we employed a novel YOLOv3 architecture, which has been proven to be fast and accurate method for object detection. It was shown that real-time detection can be achieved, even on HD images, with mAP above 88%.

ref-title.ref-titletext: Automated road sign inventory system based on stereo vision and tracking

ref-title.ref-titletext: Man vs. Computer: Benchmarking machine learning algorithms for traffic sign recognition

reference.ref-fulltext: J. Stallkamp, M. Schlipsing, J. Salmen, and C. Igel, "Man vs. computer: Benchmarking machine learning algorithms for traffic sign recognition," Neural Networks, vol. 32, pp. 323-332, 2012, selected Papers from IJCNN 2011.
